benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to account

covered: Valid Request: Multiple TC scenarios (TC01, TC03, TC04, TC15, TC16, TC17, TC24, TC25, TC26) validate successful PUT with proper payloads and various headers.
Authorization: Tests cover missing/invalid token (TC12) and valid token usage across scenarios.
Error handling: Invalid accountId (TC06), non-existent account (TC07), missing header (TC08), missing body (TC09), malformed JSON (TC10), invalid CustomField schema (TC11).
Missing/empty input edge cases: empty array (TC15), missing request body (TC09).
Large payloads and performance: large array (TC04), high payload size/limits (TC26).
Integration/dependencies: audit logs (TC27), external reporting (TC28), accessibility (TC29).
Recovery/timeout: transient network error retry (TC22), timeout (TC19).
Availability/server health: server down (TC13), dependency failure (TC14).
gaps: Partial Update behavior not explicitly tested (PUT semantics on partial updates or field-level granularity).
Concurrency/Race condition on a single account during simultaneous updates not explicitly covered (specific per-resource concurrency).
Forbidden vs. unauthorized distinction not covered (only 401 shown; 403 not exercised).
Pagination concepts not applicable to a single PUT operation, but overall data listing scenarios are not tested here (if applicable in related GET flows).
recommendations: Add a scenario explicitly validating partial updates (reject or handle as per API contract) to cover PUT semantics for partially provided payloads.
Add concurrency/race condition tests for the same account ID to ensure proper locking/volume safety.
Introduce tests around caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) to verify client-side caching expectations.
Add rate limiting/throttling tests to ensure the API handles high request load gracefully.
Include a test distinguishing 401 (unauthorized) from 403 (forbidden) to explicitly validate authorization behaviors, and consider 403 coverage if applicable.
If pagination is relevant for related GET/list endpoints, add tests there; for PUT itself, ensure positioning of tests relative to any bulk operations.
